page.title: 01Location of Area
page.content: The block lies in the County of Bedfordshire. It is 10 miles west of the County town of Bedford, in the valley of the River Great Ouse. There are no villages in the block, to the north lies the village of Podington, to the south Harrold, to the east Odell and to the west Bozeat, a Northamptonshire village. There is evidence of Roman settlement in the area, and at Dungee Corner there was a Roman road junction, of roads from Bozeat and Irthlingborough. The area has only got 6 dwellings within it, 3 of which are farmhouses with industrial activities now being carried out in the outbuildings. There is an industrial area and a drag racing track, but most of the area is arable farmland and woodland. This is possibly the least inhabited area of Bedfordshire.
